from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QApplication
from PyQt5 import QtCore
from app.classes import *
import time
import numpy as np
from scipy import optimize
from pprint import pprint

QApplication.setAttribute(QtCore.Qt.AA_EnableHighDpiScaling, True) #enable highdpi scaling
app = QApplication([])

steps = 512    # number of steps in sweep is now in firmware

ValidIp = "^(([0-9]|[1-9][0-9]|1[0-9]{2}|2[0-4][0-9]|25[0-5])\.){3}([0-9]|[1-9][0-9]|1[0-9]{2}|2[0-4][0-9]|25[0-5])$";
ip_regex = QtCore.QRegExp(ValidIp)
        
GenSetTime = 10              # Time spent between when freq is changed to when ADC is read (settle time)
NumSampAver = 2              # number of ADC samples to average per frequency (eg read N, sum and divide by N)
TotSwCyc = 640               # total number of sweep cycles to do (sweep cycle is up and down)
ChunkSwCyc = 256             # intermediate number of sweep cycles to do before sending portion (chunk) back to host
ADCConfig = 32780

TestTable = NumBytes_byte + bytes.fromhex('04') + b''.join(FreqBytes)
test_freqs = True

[docs]def poly(p,x):
    '''Thirdorder polynomial for fitting'''
    return p[0] + p[1]*x + p[2]*np.power(x,2) + p[3]*np.power(x,3) #+ p[4]*np.power(x,4)



[docs]def fit_wings(wings,sweep):
    '''Fit to wings with scipy, wings is 4 element list of portions of sweep to use, sweep is list'''
    bounds = [x*len(sweep) for x in wings]
    data = [(x,y) for x,y in enumerate(sweep) if (bounds[0]<x<bounds[1] or bounds[2]<x<bounds[3])]
    X = np.array([x for x,y in data])
    Y = np.array([y for x,y in data])
    
    errfunc = lambda p, x, y: poly(p,x) - y
    pi = [0.01, 0.8, 0.01, 0.001,0.00001]  # initial guess
    pf, success = optimize.leastsq(errfunc, pi[:], args=(X,Y))  # perform fit    
    return pf



[docs]class TestUDP():
    '''Temporary test of UDP, to provide noisy signals to average'''
    def __init__(self,sweep_num):
        self.num_left = sweep_num
        

[docs]    def get_sigs(self):  
        time.sleep(0.001)
        #if self.new_sigs: return self.new_sigs.pop()
        if self.num_left>0: 
            for curves in test_sigs: 
                p_test = [i+random.random()*0.5 for i in curves[0]]
                d_test = [i+random.random()*0.5 for i in curves[1]]
            new_sigs = ((tuple(p_test),tuple(d_test)),)
            self.num_left-=1
            return new_sigs
        else: return
